meanings.definition: Excessive fondness for acquiring and possessing books.
meanings.sent1: Her bibliomania led her to fill every corner of her room with books.
meanings.sent2: John's bibliomania was evident from the overflowing bookshelves in his house.
meanings.sent3: The librarian joked that her bibliomania was so extreme, she even dreamt of books.
meanings.sent4: His bibliomania was like a hungry monster, always craving more books to devour.
meanings.sent5: The bibliomania of the old man was so intense that he could identify any book by its smell alone.

meanings.definition: A passion for collecting and owning books.
meanings.sent1: Samantha's bibliomania drove her to visit every bookstore in town.
meanings.sent2: The collector's bibliomania was evident in the rare editions he owned.
meanings.sent3: His bibliomania was so strong that he even collected books about collecting books.
meanings.sent4: Her bibliomania was a treasure hunt, always seeking the next prized book.
meanings.sent5: The bibliomania of the book club members made their meetings lively and exciting.

meanings.sent1: Mark's bibliomania was so intense that he spent all his savings on books.
meanings.sent2: The professor's bibliomania was well-known among his students.
meanings.sent3: Her bibliomania reached new heights when she started reading in her sleep.
meanings.sent4: The bibliomania of the writer was like a flame, burning brightly with each new book.
meanings.sent5: The bibliomania of the young girl was so contagious that her friends started reading more too.
